column1: A gruff squire on horseback with shiny top boots. Soft day
column3: your honor!... Day!... Day!... Two top boots jog dangling on to Dublin. Lal the ral the ra. Lal the ral the raddy.—That reminds me
column4: Mr. Deasy said. You can do me a favor
column6: with some of your literary friends. I have a letter here for the press. Sit down a moment. I have just to copy the end.He went to the desk near the window
column7: pulled in his chair twice and read off some words from the sheet on the drum of his typewriter.—Sit down. Excuse me
column9: the dictates of common sense. Just a moment.He peered from under his shaggy brows at the manuscript by his elbow and
column11: began to prod the stiff buttons of the keyboard slowly
column12: sometimes blowing as he screwed up the drum to erase an error.
